Backbone.OnFire.name: Backbone.OnFire
Backbone.OnFire.description: Public interface to Backbone On Fire global methods.

Application.name: Application
Application.description:
The Application serves as a namespace as
well as providing the interface to define
and interact with the Backbone On Fire application.

Controller.name: Controller
Controller.description:
A Controller manages routes and handles
the setup and coordination of views, models,
and collections within a given root segment.

Model.name: Model
Model.description:
Backbone.OnFire models always parse when instantiated
to ensure relationships are instantiated.

params.name: attributes
params.description:
When creating an instance of a model,
you can pass in the initial values of
the attributes, which will be set on
the model.

params.name: options
params.description:
If you pass a `{collection: ...}` as
the options, the model gains a collection
property that will be used to indicate
which collection the model belongs to,
and is used to help compute the model's
url. The model.collection property is
normally created automatically when you
first add a model to a collection. Note
that the reverse is not true, as passing
this option to the constructor will not
automatically add the model to the collection.
Useful, sometimes.

RouteCreator.name: RouteCreator
RouteCreator.description: Factory to create routes for a given controller.

params.name: controller
params.description: Controller to generate route for

classitems.description:
Initialization function called when a
controller is instantiated. By default
`initialize` is a noop left to be implemented
by the child class.
classitems.name: initialize

classitems.description:
Convenience method to call through to the
dispatcher and register events.
classitems.name: on

params.name: event
params.description: Name of the event to register.

params.name: handler
params.description:
Function to be called when the event
is triggered.

classitems.description:
Convenience method to call through to the
dispatcher and deregister events.
classitems.name: off

params.name: event
params.description: Name of the event to deregister.

params.name: handler
params.description:
Handler function to remove a specific
event handler. If handler is ommitted
all events attached to the event will
be removed.

classitems.description: Route definitions for the controller.

Creates a method on the controller
which calls the given method on the dispatcher.

classitems.description:
Validate controller name is defined
and is a `String`.

params.description: Controller name.

Convenience method to extend a given Controller
prototype with an options object.

Name of controller.
The "Controller" suffix will be added if ommitted.

Optional methods and properties
belonging to the Controller constrcutor's prototype.

params.description:
Object defining methods and

classitems.description:
Automatically instantiate relationships when data
is set/changed if relationships are defined.

classitems.description:
Convenience method to determine if the model
has been persisted. This method is the inverse
of `isNew`.

return.description: Wheter or not the model has been persisted.

classitems.description:
Create a `rootSegment` based on the Controller name or the root.
Given a Controller name of PostsController, the `rootSegement`
would be set to `posts`. If a Controller defines a `root` property
the `root` property will be used instead.
classitems.name: createRouteActions

classitems.description:
Create route mappings on the Controller's router
for all of the Controller's routes.
classitems.name: createRoutes

return.description: Controller name without the "Controller" suffix in lower case.

classitems.description: Determine if the Controller has an explicit index route.
classitems.name: hasIndexRoute

return.description: Whether or not the Controller defines an index route.

classitems.description: Remove beginning and trailing slashes on all defined routes.

classitems.description: Ensure all routes have corresponding actions defined on the Controller.
classitems.name: validateRoutes

classitems.description: Deterimine if this is the IndexController.
classitems.name: isIndexController

return.description: Whether or not this controller is the IndexController.

classitems.description: Create default routes for the IndexController.
classitems.name: createIndexRoutes
